arts.ttl: Serie A | Venezia 2-1 Cagliari: Match Report
arts.sum: Venezia clinched a crucial 2-1 victory against Cagliari, marking their first win since October 30. The match, held at the Pier Luigi Penzo stadium, saw Francesco Zampano and Luka Sverko score the goals that propelled the home team to a much-needed three points. The post Serie A | Venezia 2-1 Cagliari: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Venezia v Cagliari: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: Venezia's manager Eusebio Di Francesco faces a defensive reshuffle for Sunday's Serie A encounter, following Michael Svoboda's season-ending ACL injury sustained in the recent 2-2 draw against Juventus. Giorgio Altare, on loan from Cagliari, is expected to fill the gap in Venezia's three-man backline. The post Serie A | Venezia v Cagliari: Probable starting lineups appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Venezia vs. Cagliari: a relegation clash
arts.sum: Cagliari are the team against which Venezia has played the most home games without ever losing in Serie A, recording two wins and two draws in four such matches. After losing their first Serie A meeting with Cagliari in November 1966, Venezia have since gone unbeaten in the next seven matches against the Sardinians in the competition (W3 D4) which is already their record of consecutive games without defeat against a single opponent in the top-flight.

arts.ttl: Venezia’s Di Francesco: “Cagliari is experienced. Svoboda’s Injury? Something will need to be done in January”
arts.sum: Venezia coach Eusebio Di Francesco addressed the media ahead of his team's upcoming match against Cagliari at the Stadio Penzo. The manager discussed the challenges posed by their opponents, recent injuries, and the team's development. The post Venezia’s Di Francesco: “Cagliari is experienced. Svoboda’s Injury? Something will need to be done in January” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Venezia v Cagliari: Match Preview
arts.sum: As the Serie A season progresses, the upcoming clash between Venezia and Cagliari at Stadio Pier Luigi Penzo promises to be a critical encounter for both teams, who find themselves entrenched in the relegation battle. Scheduled for Sunday, this match is not just another fixture; it represents a vital opportunity for both clubs to secure points that could prove essential for their survival hopes.
